plants.name: Lupinus polyphyllus
plants.description: A perennial herbaceous plant native to western North America, known for its tall spikes of densely packed flowers. It often grows in meadows and along streams.
plants.funFact: Lupines improve soil fertility by fixing nitrogen through symbiosis with bacteria in their roots.

plants.name: Hibiscus rosa-sinensis
plants.description: A tropical shrub that produces large, showy flowers. It thrives in warm climates and is widely cultivated for ornamental purposes.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in tropical climates, prominently blooming in summer months
plants.funFact: Hibiscus flowers are edible and used to make a popular tart herbal tea called 'sorrel' or 'agua de Jamaica'.

plants.name: Alcea rosea
plants.description: A tall biennial or short-lived perennial plant with large, colorful flowers clustered along upright stems. Commonly grown in cottage gardens.
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide, native to Asia and Europe
plants.funFact: Hollyhocks are important nectar sources for pollinators like bees and butterflies.

plants.name: Banksia ericifolia
plants.description: A shrub endemic to coastal southeastern Australia, producing bright orange or red cylindrical flower spikes.
plants.funFact: Banksias have woody seed cones that open to release seeds after fire, an adaptation to Australian bushfires.
